subtitle.translate: Get a Steam Engine, the machine you'll be using to fuel plenty of your future machines

description: /a/Steam Engines/a/ provide a great way to power your factories and farms, and are /b/easily scalable/b/ with your needs.
They need three components to function: /9/Heat/9/, /9/Size/9/, and /9/Water/9/.

/9/Heat/9/ is the usage of a fueled /a/Blaze Burner/a/ to heat the /a/Steam Engine/a/ from under the tank. Each /a/Blaze Burner/a/ can provide one /e/heat level/e/, with 2x2 tanks up to /e/Level 4/e/ and 3x3 tanks up to /e/Level 9/e/. Blaze burners can be /e/Superheated/e/ to provide an extra level, allowing 3x3 tanks to have /e/Level 18/e/.

/9/Water/9/ is the pumping of water into the /a/Fluid Tanks/a/ of the /a/Steam Engine/a/ in order to provide a constant flow of water ready to be heated into steam. The Steam Engine /c/ignores water inside the tanks/c/ when created; you need a /b/constant flow of water **that's fast enough**/b/ from the /a/Mechanical Pump/a/.
/9/Size/9/ is the amount of /b/Fluid Tanks/b/ in the steam engine. As long as they all appear connected, they are. It doesn't get simpler than that.
Confused? /b/Ponder the Steam Engine/b/! Search it up in the item browser and ponder it from the tooltip.
